info.description: This is documentation for the San Diego Police Department Incident API. The API is located at https://sandiego-police-data.herokuapp.com/
info.title: San Diego Police Incident Data API Documentation

get.summary: Get police inidents.  Optional search available for multiple fields
get.description: Get incidents by searching various fields, including: incident number, priority, beat, neighbrhood, street, street number, date, start date, end date, disposition code, disposition description, call type, and/or call type description.

parameters.name: number
parameters.description: The incident number for the incident you want to fetch.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: The priority number of the incidents you want to fetch.

parameters.name: beat
parameters.description: The beat number of the incidents you want to fetch.  See `/beats` endpoint to see all beats.

parameters.name: neighborhood
parameters.description: The neighborhood of the incidents you want to fetch.  See `/beats` endpoint to see all beats with neighborhood names.

parameters.name: disp_code
parameters.description: The disposition code for the incidents you want to fetch.  A disposition is the 'result' of the incident - such as Arrest, Report, etc.  See `/dispositions` endpoint to see all dispositions.

parameters.name: disp_desc
parameters.description: The disposition description for the incidents you want to fetch.  A disposition is the 'result' of the incident - such as Arrest, Report, etc.  See `/dispositions` endpoint to see all dispositions.

parameters.name: call_code
parameters.description: The call type code for the incidents you want to fetch.  Call types categorize the nature of the incident when it was reported, such as Fire, Serious Injury Accident, etc.  See `/call_types` endpoint to see all call types.

parameters.name: call_desc
parameters.description: The call type description for the incidents you want to fetch.  Call types categorize the nature of the incident when it was reported, such as Fire, Serious Injury Accident, etc.  See `/call_types` endpoint to see all call types.

parameters.name: street
parameters.description: The street name for the incidents that you want to fetch.  Do NOT include street numbers, directions (N, S, etc) or suffixes (Dr., St., etc).

parameters.name: street_number
parameters.description: The street number for the incidents that you want to fetch.  This will often be chained with a street query described above.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date for the incidents that you want to fetch.  This will return all incidents on the date provided.  Date query must be provided in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date for the incidents that you want to fetch.  Often used in combination with an end date query (see below).  If no end date is provided, it will return all incidents beginning on this date through the lastest date available in the data set. Start date query must be provided in YYYY-MM-DD format.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date for the incidents that you want to fetch.  Often used in combination with a start date query (see above).  If no start date is provided, it will return all incidents from the beginning of the data set through the end date provided. End date query must be provided in YYYY-MM-DD format.
